column4: Anyone? I'm trying to register a new driver and I can't find a .inf file in the driver so I can't follow the ubuntu site's help
Anyone? I'm trying to register a new driver and I can't find a .inf file in the driver so I can't follow the ubuntu site's help

If its a windows driver installer, the driver files will be packed inside the installer. Use something like UniExtract to get ithem out of it. That's a windows tool, and I don't know of a linux equivalent. I have no idea why linux would be able to use a windows driver...
Don't know if it would be able to use it. .... .
use "Shoryu:" at the beginning... it'll notify me that you messaged me.
Righto, will do. Anyway of doing it then, I know what the driver is I need, I just don't know how to get it into ubuntu.
Um... well if you're d/ling a windows driver... an exe. That will not work afaik. You need to get the linux version of the driver.
What "ubuntu" tutorial are you following anyways?
Wireless troubleshooting section on the help section for the latest version. I don't think I'll be able to find a linux version :L
Paste a URL
https://help.ubuntu.com/10.10/internet/C/troubleshooting-wireless.html

Ah... I see ... NDISWrapper .... Well.. Like I said, there WILL be an INF file. Windows must have that. What is in the folder the installer extracts? And are you able to use UniExtract on a windows computer?
Also make sure you haven't simply downloaded a utility rather than a wireless driver.

I'm fairly sure it's a driver, in the folder I got when I ran the .exe I found a variety of .dlls and .exes. I don't know if that software works but I don't know it's necessary. Is there any way I can find the drivers windows has a take the .inf from there?
If there's another setup.exe, it would be in there. Run UniExtract on it so that it doesn't put it whereever it pleases.
its tough picking out the driver from the windows/system32/drivers folder after it installs it. That's why I use UniExtract.
I tried UniExtract on the exe, and I got exactly the same as when I ran it on its own. I used the setup.exe too, and that looks like it's going to put the drivers in System32 and to a restart :L
There will be an inf file in there somewhere.
Tell me what driver you got... link me to it.
Ack. *facepalm* There is a .inf file there. It was stuck between a .ini and a .inx, is why I didn't see it D:
INX?? ... ppl using crazy file exts ... well glad you found it. Good luck with that.
Thank you for using the live help system.
XD Thanks, don't worry, I'll be back if something else goes wrong :P
